review.title: Americas Best Value Inn, Pacifica, CA
review.reviewText: This hotel is close walking distance to Pacific Ocean, and eating places.  Nice clean hotel. Staff friendly and helpful. Breakfast was toast, cold cereal, and pastries, juice and milk. Perfect place to sleep and close to San Francisco. Easy on and off the Freeway.  Nice quiet community.
review.positiveRemarks: Proximity to Airport, San Francisco, Easy on and off Freeway to go north or south. Walking distance to Ocean.

review.reviewText:
Un happy with response of hotel staff in response to a problem we had.  
We called them twice and never got back an answer to the problem. 
Felt they were unsympathetic to us and our concern

review.title: Good for the price.
review.reviewText: I was able to open the window and not have to deal with traffic noise.  Made for great sleeping.  Also liked that I didn't have to sit on the bed to watch TV
They were prompt will you ran the bell. Nice staff. clean rooms good price.

review.title: Excellent 2-week stay!
review.reviewText: This was my wife's and my second time staying at this hotel. Our first was last year. With no complaints from last year, this year was even better!  We had a great view of the ocean, and it was wonderful opening that big window to present the new day. The Continental breakfast included fresh fruit.  The bed was absolutely perfect, and the most important part of rejuvenating ourselves after a full day of exploring.
review.positiveRemarks: The room and bathroom were immaculate. The cleaning staff was so endearing and helpful.  The husband and wife who run the hotel together were so nice.
review.negativeRemarks: Well, bagels included in the Continental breakfast would be fantastic!
review.locationRemarks: There are many cute shops, with many enjoyable eating spots for a variety of cuisine choices.  Our favorite was walking along the nearby beach.

review.reviewText: We stayed in the hotel twice.  It is close to beaches and to the pier.
review.negativeRemarks: The refrigerator in the room was a bit noisy. I ended up unplugging it during the night.

review.title: Convenient to San Francisco by car.  Safepark
review.reviewText: Convenient by car to San Francisco.  Safe off street parking.  Very clean, recently remodeled.  Comfortable queen size beds.
review.positiveRemarks: Safe, quiet, clean

review.title: Noisy motel on top of freeway.
review.reviewText:
The manager was fairly indifferent and the continental breakfast was pretty minimal.  Not even
decaf coffee.
review.positiveRemarks: Not much.

review.title: Stay Away
review.reviewText: This plac.e is nothing like it's review. Location is a.block from ocean if you don't mind walking through a seedy area. Beach stinks. 1st hint of trouble- desk clerk is behind a dirty plastic protective shield. We never even finished checking in. Run from this one.
review.positiveRemarks: Can't think of a thing
review.negativeRemarks: Demolition would be the first improvement
review.locationRemarks:
Ocean is a risky one block away
Saw a couple of dives close by.

review.title: Easy access. Good parking. Clean. Good location.
review.reviewText: Exceeded expectations. Relatively affordable.  Convenient location. Safe area. Generally good accommodations. Thank you.
review.positiveRemarks: Easy access. Good parking. Clean. Large beds. Good location.
review.locationRemarks: Close to pier, easy drive to Rockaway Beach.  Overall, a convenient location to SF, Pacifica, HMB, etc.

review.title: Good value motel near old town Pacifica and beach
review.reviewText: This motel worked very well for us as a value.   It was within several blocks of the reason for our visit (the nearby high school soccer fields) and was reasonably comfortable, clean, and safe.   Room had an efficient and working fridge and microwave, and TV cable.   Wi-Fi worked very well.   Continental breakfast, while not a lot of variety, worked well for us as well.
review.positiveRemarks: Very good location based on reason for our visit; rooms were safe, clean, and had the basic amenities (fridge, microwave, wi-fi, tv) that we needed.
review.negativeRemarks: furnishings/carpet are obviously well-used.   Based on the price-point we were overall very pleased with our selection
review.locationRemarks: This motel is about 1/2 mile from the Pacifica pier and associated beach.   Also, a local golf course is within the same distance.  Close to Hiway 1

review.title: CLOSE TO PACIFICA PIER
review.reviewText: GOOD COMPLIMENT IS A FREE PARKING AND A WALKING DISTANCE TO PACIFICA PIER.
review.positiveRemarks: CLOSE TO THE PIER
review.negativeRemarks: NEW TOWELS, NO HAIR ON THE TOWELS

review.title: Nice hotel...
review.reviewText: Within walking distance of market and beach. Hotel staff was very pleasant and accomodating. Only downside is no pots, pans or dishes in kitchenette room and no fruit with continental breakfast.
review.positiveRemarks: Proximity to beach and market. Hotel staff very pleasant.
review.negativeRemarks: Have pots, pans and dishes in kitchenette rooms.
review.locationRemarks: Just off the highway; easy to get to. Nice shops within walking distance. Excellent Thai restaurant one block away.

review.reviewText: Passing through Pacifica so this hotel worked for our family. We needed an affordable place to stay for one night and this hotel was just right. Quick check in was a plus. Room was ok, breakfast was plain...pastries,coffee, cereal, juice and milk. For one night, this hotel was good.

review.title: Horrible experience
review.reviewText: Staff member did not greet my boyfriend and I. He wasn't even friendly while checking us in. We tried to ignore him and enjoy our trip. When we went to the room, the toilet was dirty, the bath tub looked like it had a sticky residue left from the bottom of a bathmat, AND the bed sheet had a piece of hair and some sort of stain. I called the front desk and asked for new sheets. He told me,"come downstairs and I'll give it to you" I said,"can't you send someone else to bring it up?" He said,"I'll be right there" AND HUNG UP ON ME. He gets to the room and puts out his hand with the sheets like we bothered him for coming up to give it. My boyfriend then said"who's going to change it?" And he says,"You". Then I said,"So we check into a dirty hotel with dirty sheets and we're supposed to change it? You don't have a maid or anything?" He says,"No maid right now". My boyfriend then says,"Take those sheets back cause we're not staying here". And he says,"Okay that's fine, I'll give you back your money". I'm from Pacifica! I did not think this experience was going to be this bad. The room was $123 dollars. Are u kidding me?

review.title: Disgusting and Horrible customer service
review.reviewText: When we first got the hotel we notice the toilet backed up full of toilet paper. My husband was at the store so I called front desk. The attendant told me for ME to go downstairs and get a plunger. I could not believe it. I went downstairs and asked again if there was a maintenance man and he said no, I asked can you go do it? and he said no, I asked can we get another room and he said no! I said told him it was very unprofessional and he said to leave a review. I would have left but there was no rooms available, we were tired & it was late. I asked my 14 y.o. son to unplug it and as he was trying a CONDOM came up floating... disgusting!!! When my husband came back he went to the front desk and demanded them to do their job. The attendant had the guts to suggest it was us (even though we had been in the room for 2 minutes when I called him). After arguing with my husband for a bit, all of a sudden they DID have a maintenance guy &  a snake to fix the toilet. They came upstairs 5 minutes later and fixed it... but not before leaving a dripping mess all over the bathroom floor and room entrance. My husband HAD to ask them to clean it up, they were going to leave it like that! I never complain about hotels, we usually stay at affordable hotels & know they will have it's imperfections... but this was beyond horrible. Next day when I exited the lobby he only gave me a dirty look as I passed by, later when my husband checked out he said "sorry about yesterday" HORRIBLE & DISGUSTING!
review.positiveRemarks: nothing!
review.negativeRemarks: customer service and room cleanliness

review.title: Old hotel that need some deep cleaning
review.reviewText: I have chosen this hotel because no other was available by the time I booked my travel. As other travellers pointed, there is a strong smell from cleaning material and other things in the corridors and the reception areas. The room that allocated to me was in the front, overlooking the freeway and was very noisy. I've asked to change, and the room towards the see was quiet. As far as I can say, the towels, linen and bathroom were clean, although the carpet in the room need proper deep cleaning (or replacement). The room décor is very dated, and the breakfast is a joke - so don't rely on it. It was expensive for its quality
review.positiveRemarks: Not much
review.negativeRemarks: clean the room and get rid of the smell, equip the room with some utensils for the kitchenette

review.title: Decent place to spend a last night before a flight
review.reviewText:
Affordable, Clean and relatively quiet. Room was No smoking but the smell of cigaretteswas very strong in hallways. Breakfast was a joke: a couple do packaged pastries and coffee. Cafe Pacifica a few blocks away is a great alternative. 
Hotel receptionist was definitely not an hospitality professional. We clearly disturbed him out of a nap when we arrived around 10pm.
review.positiveRemarks: Close to SFO, low price
review.negativeRemarks: Receptionist attitude. Soap and shampoo.

review.title: Good and quiet hotel near highway (and the Ocean)
review.reviewText:
It was a storm night. Fortunately I got a parking spot under the roof near the rear entry - no need to worry about getting wet. Room was ok. Wish it had a better lighting (cold fluorescent) and furniture needs update.
Comfortable enough and quiet even though it is right next to highway. Breakfast was good and plenty.
Not much to do near by. 7-Eleven is a few blocks away (need a car anyway).  I saw local bar and restaurant in a few blocks but I did not try,
review.positiveRemarks: Clean and comfortable. Convenient location to my destination (Duly City).
review.negativeRemarks: Furnishing and power outlets (for phones, laptops and gadgets we need to charge)
review.locationRemarks: Close from the Ocean. Not too far from SFO if you drive. Not too close to downtown SF but you could stay here and drive to the city.

review.title: Good location.
review.reviewText: About 2 blocks from the beach, small older but well maintained. We were on the third floor and had a decent view of the ocean from our side of the motel. There is a freeway on one side of the motel, but we were on the other side and noise from the freeway was not noticeable.
review.positiveRemarks: Location.

review.title: Convenient location
review.reviewText: Comfortable bed, clean room.  Continental breakfast was not extensive, but sufficient.

review.title: Hotel very well located
review.reviewText: Every thing was fine except the cleanliness in the bathroom. The shower area was dirty and stain.
review.positiveRemarks: Location
review.negativeRemarks: The cleanliness in the bathroom, and for the breakfast get some apples and banana help a lot

review.reviewText: We had a nice stay in this place, friendly staff. The place is close to everything. We had fun.

review.title: Bare Bones Hotel
review.reviewText: It's a bare bones hotel, perfect for a night when you need a place to stay.  Don't have high expectations going in and you won't be disappointed, as it seems some reviewers have been.
review.positiveRemarks: Relatively inexpensive. Easy to find. No surprises.
review.negativeRemarks: It's a bit noisy with the highway, although the air conditioners seem to drown it out when they're running.
review.locationRemarks: It's about 15 mins from SFSU, which was why we were up that way.  Beach is close.

review.reviewText: Seems to be over priced for what you receive. when we left the room door didn't close properly, good thing I went back to check. The furniture is aged and needs to be replaced. Ok for one night when your tired.
review.negativeRemarks: The furniture and carpet. I didn't consider the breakfast as breakfast its more of a continental breakfast sweet rolls ,toast and cold cereal.

review.reviewText: Stayed there with my wife and son and daughter for four days and three nights. Every time we arrived we were able to park just a few steps away from the elevator to our room which was clean and roomy with free Wifi. Being two blocks away from the beach I found that to be very convenient, not having to look for parking far away. It was nice and I would stay there again.
review.negativeRemarks: The "continental" breakfast could use some upgrading. Adding waffles, pancakes and eggs would make it more complete.

review.title: Nice hotel, convenient for Wintern's Tacer
review.reviewText: I chose this hotel because for it's location. Our band was playing at Winter's Tavern which was 4 blocks away. This meant we could drink and relax without worrying about driving. The hotel attendant was friendly and their were no hassles. Worked out great.
review.positiveRemarks: The room is spacious with nice amenities. Morning coffee and pastry are appreciated. Great neighborhood.
review.negativeRemarks: Hmmm...thinner curtains that allow more light in when closed, maybe.
review.locationRemarks: Wintern's Tavern, where our band played, The fishing pier is just 2 blocks away next to the beach and ocean view walk.

managementResponses.response:
Thank you for your comments. I’m sorry to hear that w failed to exceed your expectations. We believe we provide a good combination of amenities, convenience and value. I apologize if there were lapses during your stay through the busy spring break season. We’re changing and improving every day, and I hope you’ll be back with us again next year at this time. We learn from every comment and will take everything you’ve said into consideration.

Sincerely, Manager

review.title: disappointed
review.reviewText: Hotel reception was not friendly, Continental breakfast was very small, just cereal milk, juice and Danishes, no fruit. The internet was slow,The room was clean but for the price we paid we could have stayed in a nicer hotel for 2 days for the same price. Over all it was very disappointing.
review.positiveRemarks: Not much!
review.negativeRemarks: Expand your breakfast to include more, make your internet better and lower your prices.
review.locationRemarks: the only thing that I could see that was good is that you could go to the nearby beaches and watch the surfers.

managementResponses.response:
Thank you for commenting about our hotel and noting its great location.
I personally apologize that there were maintenance issues with your
room. If you had notified us of these issues during your stay, we could
have moved you to another room. We are now rechecking all rooms now to
make sure that the problems you mentioned no longer exist in any rooms,
and we appreciate you mentioning them to us in this review. We strive to
satisfy all customers, and I'm sincerely sorry that we did not meet your
needs or expectations.

Thanks, Manager

review.title: Cheap, rundown hotel, but great location
review.reviewText: While the bed was comfortable, and we had good water pressure and a flat screen TV, there were many issues. The toilet had a leak, the bathroom doorknob didn't work, the smoke detector went off if the shower steam touched it, and the microwave looked like it was from 1952. This hotel was next to the freeway, but in walking distance to the beach, pier, and many local shops, restaurants, and markets.

managementResponses.response:
Dear:Joe
Please allow me this opportunity to apologize the inconvenience you experienced during your stay at our hotel on 12/14/ 2013.
appreciate you taking the time to advise us of your dissatisfaction. There is never an excuse for providing a valued gust. such as you. with anything less then a perfect experience.

We credit our success in the loading industry to providing good and quality accommodation at affordable price. We appreciate your willingness to take the time to let us know where improvement is needed so that we may continue our high standards.

I apologize for the inconvenience this caused you and have taken corrective action to ensure that this incident will not occur in the future.as credit for the disappointing stay you had at the hotel. I hope you will give us an opportunity to service your future loading needs.

Sincerely,
Carlos,Manager
Abvipacifica

review.title: Close to San Francisco
review.reviewText: Bath towels were horrible

review.title: Hotel Overlooking Highway
review.reviewText: I stayed two nights and had very little sleep due to the freeway noise.
review.positiveRemarks: The location is good for someone who needs to be in that area with so little from which to choose.
review.negativeRemarks: There could be someone at the front desk once in a while or least a bell to ring for someone. This hotel is almost employeeless.
review.locationRemarks: I needed to be in the area for business so it was a good location for upper Peninsula.

review.title: Noisy
review.reviewText: I thought this would be convenient to the airport. It was easy to find but the hotel is in a sketchy section of town and was incredibly noisy. (Close to route 1)

review.title: it was ok
review.reviewText: the room was ok, parking was good, I got to park in a carport behind the hotel. the area used for the continental breakfast was small and crowded, it consisted of three small tables in the lobby of the hotel. otherwise it was fpne!
review.positiveRemarks: the location to restaurants and highways as well as local shops and the ocean made it great
review.negativeRemarks: a different set up for the breakfast area
review.locationRemarks: access to the ocean front, pier and shops made it nice

review.title: Simple hotel close to the beach
review.reviewText: We stayed one night only. The room was clean, everything was working, but old. 5min walk to the beach and a golf club. Good for walking and relaxing. The staff was polite.
review.positiveRemarks: Location
review.negativeRemarks: Breakfast!!!!

review.title: our stay
review.reviewText: We enjoyed it very much, we would tell anyone to stay there, we were there only 1 night but did enjoy our stay.
review.positiveRemarks: The location and lay out of the room
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing that I can think of
review.locationRemarks: Lots of things but we did not have the time to enjoy it all

review.title: Easy Access to City and Beach
review.reviewText: The hotel is very close to the Ocean, within walking distance, also a very easy drive into the city if you desire to check out San Francisco. Don't expect too much from the continental breakfast, if you do want an actual breakfast there are plenty of restaurants that are close by. The room it self was cleanly and didn't have any problems sleeping in it. I would recommend this place to anyone who wants to check out the San Francisco area on a budget.

review.title: America's Best Value? LOL
review.reviewText: Half eaten cheetos under the bed, very unfriendly staff, no spare blankets.....

review.title: Dirty and curry smelling hotel!
review.reviewText: The moment I walked in the building, I already smell the scent of curry. The smell is so strong I can still smell it up to my room. The towels and comforters are dirty. The towels needs to be replaced or soaked with bleach. The location is very close to freeway..I can hear the cars passing by. Although The place is a walking distance to the pier but overall not a good place to stay..the Hotel owner should have somewhere else to prepare their food. The curry smell gave me and my family nausea...we just dropped off our things, came back late and checked out very early. Or else I'll have nausea and vomiting.
review.positiveRemarks: Location
review.negativeRemarks: Dirty and curry smelling

review.title: Pacifica hotel
review.reviewText: I didn't like that you could hear the cars passing by on the freeway. Breakfast was just cold cereal.
review.positiveRemarks: It was close to the beach.
review.negativeRemarks: Bad breakfast.
review.locationRemarks: Close to the ocean but even closer to freeway.

review.title: Would Definitely Book This Hotel in Pacifica Again
review.reviewText: Great hotel for what our family needed. Stayed 6 nights, really only there to sleep and shower. We spent most of our time in San Francisco and out sight seeing. Only 4 hours from the Redwood Forest, 2 hours from Big Sur and 11/2 from Napa Valley. Safe neighborhood, friendly staff.
review.positiveRemarks: Location
review.locationRemarks: 4.5 miles to BART, $2 parking and $6 roundtrip to ride train into San Fran

review.title: Good business hotel
review.reviewText: I arrived and they were expecting me .For the value it was neat the room was cleaned everyday and they had good tv channels and the internet was free and its a short distance from the town and airport.Its great for business people
review.positiveRemarks: cleaned every day and free wifi

review.title: Stayed here twice, will stay again.
review.reviewText: Overall, if you're looking for an affordable, no hassle place to stay, this is a good place. I like staying here when I travel to San Francisco as its close to the city, and located in the beautiful, laid-back city of Pacifica. It is only a few blocks from the ocean, as well. This is not a luxury hotel; if you require a lot of attention, want more upscale digs, or are looking for a classy, perks type of experience, this place will disappoint. But, if like me, you're more simple, just looking for a clean, easy place to stay, this place is perfect. A plus, as well, is that they do offer smoking rooms.
review.positiveRemarks: Easy to get to, good location, no hassle.
review.negativeRemarks: If you book through a third-party site, you will have to pay a refundable deposit if you do not have your credit card with you.
review.locationRemarks: Only a few blocks from the ocean. Located on a somewhat busy street, so traffic noise is sometimes heavy.

review.title: Clean, near beach and major roads
review.reviewText: We arrived back at the hotel rather late and there wasn't any parking space left in the hotel lot so we had to park onstreet.
review.positiveRemarks: convenient location for us since we needed to be near Montara and the beach is only 2 blocks away. Budget price.
review.negativeRemarks: Tired, worn, small towels.

review.title: spacy
review.reviewText: big room and good location next to San Francisco fffffffffffffffffffffff

review.title: Okay stay
review.reviewText: it was just okay. I would only stay there if all other hotels were booked.
review.positiveRemarks: walk to beach
review.negativeRemarks: staff was not friendly at all.

review.title: a distant stay for sf airport
review.reviewText: the motel isn't exactly in the sf airport proximity . They didn't have continental breakfast at 7 AM

review.title: Not a good choice
review.reviewText: Filthy rugs, furnishings and linens old in every way. Bathroom had rust around fixtures, The whole place needs an upgrade. Would not stay here again or in any other America's hotel.

review.title: Dirty
review.reviewText: Entering the building there was a smell of feces, my towels smelled, there was a blood stain on my blanket, the fire sprinklers were covered in dirt, and the morning cleaning staff were incredibly noisy, the tub was filthy.
review.negativeRemarks: Room

review.title: Nice place
review.reviewText: The hotel stay was pleasant and had a nice experience. I stayed one night only though.

review.title: just ok
review.reviewText: Ok for short stay. Price could be cheaper for for the quality

review.title: You get what you pay for
review.reviewText:
I booked this hotel on a whim because I was looking for a quick escape over the weekend and all other hotels were booked for the Saturday night. The hotel is close to the beach but not a waking distance to center of the town. However it is very close to the highway and the noise will keep you awake. The bathroom was not clean, the floor was sticky and it reeked like a public restroom. I couldn't open the window to let some fresh air in because the safety clip got stuck and I needed tools to get it to move. You get what you pay for I guess.
Will not be coming back or recommend this hotel to a friend.

review.title: A really mediocre hotel
review.reviewText: The elevator failed repeatedly to get to the third floor. Lots of trips from the 2nd to the 3rd floor on the stairs. Parking is very poor. We had a double queen with a little kitchenette. small refrigerator, microwave, sink and cabinets. Spacious room. Poor water pressure, but a decent shower head. bathroom sink aerator on the faucet sprayed water all over the sink. Sink counter was very small. There was a lingering odor of someone having violated the no smoking policy. ONLY reason I stayed here is that the Oracle convention had created a hotel room vacuum in the San Bruno area. I won't be back if I have any reasonable alternative.

review.title: Will return next trip
review.reviewText: Will return next trip

review.title: nice, reasonably priced place in Pacifica
review.reviewText: place was fine

review.title: Very clean
review.reviewText:
It seems that this place was recently remodeled, looks and smells clean.
Breakfast was not the typical coffee and cookies, they fresh fruits cereals
and juices.

review.title: A truly great value
review.reviewText: Overall, our stay at this hotel was quite satisfactory. The room provided everything that was expected, except for the mini-refrigerator which was a little faulty. But that was hardly a problem. It was a nice, clean room that was quiet despite the fact that it was adjacent to the freeway. The beach was within walking distance, as well as a few nice eateries. There was a little to be desired from the complimentary breakfast, but that too, was sufficient. Overall, it was a great value, and we would stay here again if we were in the area.

review.title: Decent Price
review.reviewText: Pretty good stay for the price considering that there are alot of really expensive hotels in SF.

review.title: Not Impressed
review.reviewText: Too close to Hwy 1. Had to leave room fan on to hide traffic noise. Nieghborhood not that great. No easy accsess to restaurants or fast food. Location did well as a base to see the sights in and around San Francisco.

review.title: Good stay
review.reviewText: I just needed a stay for the night with my family. It suited my accomodations well. Rented two rooms one came with kitchen, it was real close to the ocean and 15 minutes into San Francisco. I was realy happy as well as my family was. It was more family oriented than a romantic hotel. I would stay again with family

review.title: Wasn't impressed
review.reviewText: They are in Pacifica, bu. not a very nice plae, off the beaten path ona side street. and te price for the value.

review.title: Value Hotel
review.reviewText: I really can't complain much for a budget quick-stay hotel except that if there is more than 3 people in a room, the beds could be a little bigger. Overall, it was not too bad.

review.title: Just a spot to stop
review.reviewText: This hotel was not very nice. The room smelled and the place was overall pretty nasty. The rooms did get cleaned but I ended up buying some incense to burn to help with the smell. The bed was really uncomfortable. It worked for what we needed but I would find a different place to stay the next time.

review.title: If you need a place to rest
review.reviewText: This is a simple Hotel, so don't expect much. The rooms are comfortable if you need a place to rest for a night or two.
